required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Neonatal Evaluation of Norepinephrine Infusion in Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Section
clinical_study.official_title: Neonatal Evaluation of Norepinephrine Infusion in Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Section

brief_summary.textblock: This retrospective study aims to evaluate the fate of children born by cesarean section under spinal anesthesia with or without norepinephrine as vasopressor support for anesthesia. The main objective is to compare the initial Apgar score. The records of patients who received norepinephrine are compared to those without norepinephrine. To limit the biases of this type of study, the investigators will apply a propensity score that will include as a variable: age, ASA score, comorbidity, urgency. The patients analysed correspond to the period 2016-2017.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Just after the birth of the newborn baby
primary_outcome.description: The primary endpoint is the Umbilical Cord Lactate levels

secondary_outcome.measure: maternal arterial tension during cesarean section
secondary_outcome.description: maternal arterial tension during cesarean section

secondary_outcome.measure: incidences of mother nausea and vomiting
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from beginning to cesarean section end
secondary_outcome.description: incidences of mother nausea and vomiting

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from beginning to cesarean section end

arm_group.description: boli of ephedrine phenylephrine (45μg/mL-3mg/mL) if the variation of MAP < 20% of baseline (MAP before spinal anaesthesia).

continuous infusion of norepinepineprhine at 20 μg/mL, started at 0.05 μg/kg/min. The dosage of norepinephrine was then adjusted to maintain a variation in MAP < 20% of baseline. In case of failure, the use of a control group boli injection was possible.

study_pop.textblock: women over 18 years of age who need a caesarean section

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- age > 18
- Spinal Anesthesia for Cesarean Section
Exclusion Criteria:
- sub epidural cesarean section
- contraindication to spinal anesthesia (allergy, severe heart disease, coagulopathy)
